data.title: bd-o3f: Auto-approve review on LGTM vote
data.description: Auto-approve when LGTM and no blocks from other reviewers. Adds has_blocking_votes_from_others() query and modifies run_vote() to auto-approve.

data.reason: Security review passed. No vulnerabilities found: parameterized SQL queries prevent injection, authorization logic correctly excludes only the voter's own blocks when checking for blocking votes, proper state checks ensure only open reviews can be auto-approved.

data.title: bd-2m6: Add orphan review backup on events.jsonl truncation
data.description: When truncation or content mismatch is detected during sync, the system now saves orphaned review details to a backup file before rebuilding. This prevents silent data loss when jj workspace operations restore older events.jsonl versions.

data.title: bd-1lk: Update review_reviewers projection to support re-requesting
data.description: Use ON CONFLICT DO UPDATE instead of INSERT OR IGNORE when applying ReviewersRequested events. This allows re-requesting the same reviewer to update their requested_at timestamp, enabling the re-review workflow.

data.reason: Security review: No security concerns found. Shell scripts use proper quoting (set -euo pipefail, quoted variables), the rm -rf is guarded by a .jj directory check, no command injection vectors exist (hardcoded paths in git check-ignore), and Rust changes are pure data structure refactoring.
Security review: LGTM. Parameterized SQL queries maintained, no injection vectors. ON CONFLICT pattern matches existing reviewer_votes implementation.

data.title: bd-3is: Adopt terseid for ID generation
data.description: Replace UUID-based ID generation with terseid library. Uses IdGenerator with prefixes cr (reviews), th (threads), c (comments). Validators now use parse_id for flexible-length ID recognition.

data.reason: Security review: No security concerns. Shell scripts use proper quoting (set -euo pipefail, quoted variables). The rm -rf is guarded by .jj directory check. Rust Command::new uses array args (no shell injection). All paths are hardcoded or safely derived from repository state. TUI changes are pure sorting logic.

data.title: bd-3is: Adopt terseid for ID generation
data.description: Replace UUID-based ID generation with terseid library. Uses IdGenerator with prefixes cr (reviews), th (threads), c (comments). Validators now use parse_id for flexible-length ID recognition.

data.reason: Security review passed. The change uses cryptographically secure randomness (getrandom) with SHA256 hashing. The reduced ID space (4 base36 chars vs UUID) is a deliberate usability tradeoff, not a security concern - IDs are opaque identifiers, not auth tokens. No injection vectors, no secrets, no auth bypass paths.
Security review complete. No concerns found: proper CSPRNG (getrandom), cryptographically sound hashing (SHA256), no injection vectors, no hardcoded secrets.
